timeline.bodyText: Please convert this back to SECONDS.toMillis(expirationTimeLong). It is a standard part of the jdk and makes clear what units we are converting from and to.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: This is not the correct exception here. You actually have an integer but the parameter was not one of EX or PX. I wold argue that you should not even pass expirationParameter into this method. Let the caller that knows he is EX convert the value returned from this method to milliseconds. So less responsibility for this method.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal
dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText:
This could be simplified to:
keepTTL = optionalParametersStrings.contains("KEEPTL");
timeline.author: jdeppe-pivotal
dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: thanks- I'll look into why no test caught this...
replies.author: jhutchison

timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: I don't like that we now call parseLong twice. Once in isANumber and once in parseExpirationTime. Just have parseExpirationTime handle NumberFormatException and throw IllegalArgumentException(ERROR_NOT_INTEGER)
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: The old code used ERROR_NOT_INTEGER if it was not a number. You have changed that to ERROR_SYNTAX
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: you're right-  just checked native redis.  I'll look into lack of test here, too
replies.author: jhutchison

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be better to do this in the caller that does this for EX. Then you don't need to pass expirationParameter to this method. Its job is just parsing.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: so actually it parses the long three times! If you are going to do it here then you should have it also fill a HashMap whose keys are the option that expects a number and whose value is the number. Then this could be used later instead of parsing again.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: thanks for catching that done (in forthcoming commit)
replies.author: jhutchison

timeline.bodyText: It looks like you may have actually brought StringsIntegrationTest back to life. I think it has been removed from develop and split up into multiple, command focused tests. We now have a SetIntegrationTest so amy tests for SET that you added to this class should now be added to it instead.

replies.bodyText: whoops.  thanks-  moved Jen's earlier changes into the  SetsIntegrationTest and deleted StringsIntegrationTest

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure these tests should be added here. If you added them instead to SetIntegrationTest then I'd feel better because they would also run against native redis.
